t: Report Unsolicited Packages or Brushing Scams - Amazon Customer Service

t: Amazon
s: For those who don’t know: Brushing is when someone orders a product and has it sent to some random person. This is usually done to essentially “purchase” good metrics for sellers so as to boost their rankings in search results and product suggestions.

t: Brushing Scam: Exposing The "Free" Amazon Package Scam
s: A brushing scam is a technique used by unethical e-commerce businesses to generate fake orders and boost their seller rating. Third-party sellers on Amazon and eBay send you mystery parcels without a return address.

s: November 8, 2023 - It’s called a brushing scam because the scammer will “brush up” (embellish or create fake) reviews of their products to create a false impression of the quality of the items they sell. Another definition says that the phrase comes from how fake reviews are “brushing aside suspicion” ...
